喬冠華.definition: Qiao Guanhua (1913-1973), PRC politician and diplomat

喬叟.definition: Geoffrey Chaucer (1343-1400), English poet, author of The Canterbury Tales 坎特伯雷故事集[Kan3 te4 bo2 lei2 Gu4 shi4 Ji2]

喬巴山.definition: Choibalsan, city in Mongolia, capital of the eastern aimag (province) of Dornod; Khorloogiin Choibalsan (1895-1952), Communist leader of the Mongolian People's Republic (mid-1930s-1952)

喬布斯.definition: Jobs (name); see also 史蒂夫·喬布斯|史蒂夫·乔布斯[Shi3 di4 fu1 · Qiao2 bu4 si1], Steve Jobs

喬戈里峰.definition: K2, aka Mt. Chogir, the world's second highest peak, located in the Karakoram Range 喀喇崑崙山脈|喀喇昆仑山脉[Ka1la3kun1lun2 Shan1mai4]

喬木.definition: tree, esp. with recognizable trunk (as opposed to 灌木[guan4 mu4], bush or shrub)

喬林.definition: forest (esp. of tall trees); high forest

喬格里峰.definition: see 喬戈里峰|乔戈里峰[Qiao2ge1li3 Feng1]

喬治·奧威爾.definition: George Orwell (1903-1950), British novelist, author of Animal Farm 動物農場|动物农场 and 1984

喬治·布爾.definition: George Boole (1815-1864), English mathematician, philosopher and logician, author of The Laws of Thought and inventor of Boolean algebra

喬治·索羅斯.definition: George Soros or György Schwartz (1930-), Hungarian American financial speculator and millionaire philanthropist

喬治城.definition: Georgetown; (the spelling 喬治敦|乔治敦 is more common)

喬治城大學.definition: Georgetown University in Washington D.C., famous as quality Jesuit university and for its basketball team

喬答摩.definition: Gautama, surname of the Siddhartha, the historical Buddha

喬紅.definition: Qiao Hong (1968-), former PRC female table tennis player

喬裝.definition: to pretend; to feign; to disguise oneself

喬裝打扮.definition: to dress up in disguise (idiom); to pretend for the purpose of deceit

喬遷.definition: to move (to a superior place); promotion

喬遷之喜.definition: congratulations on house-moving or promotion (idiom); Best wishes for your new home!
